inn1.comm: good start, extra bounce from short of a length and Dilshan fends at it awkwardly but manages to send the ball straight to ground
more seam movement! Nips back from short of a length, Dilshan shapes for a cut but is cramped for room and is fortunate that the bottom edge races over the top of the stumps down to fine leg
full this time, a strangled appeal for lbw by Woakes as Dilshan tries to whip across the line but the ball was angling down the leg side
short delivery on leg stump, neatly played this time as he swivels on a pull down to long leg
back of a length on middle and leg, takes Perera high on the thigh pad as he aims into the leg side
full on the stumps, forced through the leg side between mid-on and square leg...Joe Root chases it down.
full outside off, pushed across, left alone
a handsome drive, it was a juicy delivery full outside off, Dilshan came forward and drilled through the line although the bat twisted in his hand and it wasn't perfectly timed
edged! But short of second slip. Gurney keeping it full, but just dragged the length back a touch this time and Dilshan was a little uncertain outside off although played with soft hands
short of a length, angled into leg side, takes the pad into square leg
comes forward and defends to cover
full on middle, Dilshan almost falls across as he plays this to mid-on
excellent delivery, a yorker which squeezes past off stump as Perera jabs his bat down late
full at off stump, driven firmly into the covers where it is half-stopped by Ben Stokes (of locker-punching fame)
low full toss, whipped away through square and it just about has the legs to trickle over a slow outfield into the boundary
he's good to resume and comes forward to his next delivery, defending towards mid-off
good length at off stump, blocked into the off side
whips a straight delivery with plenty of bottom hand to mid-on
full, starting just outside, Perera watchfully defends from off stump back to the bowler
this one is a touch straighter, encourages Perera to defend with a slightly closed face towards midwicket
pushed up fuller, almost a yorker, but it was a confident drive to mid-off...both openers keen to play their shots
pulls the length back, Perera hangs back a little deeper in his crease and defends to the covers
works with the angle and tucks this from off stump into the leg side, wide of midwicket
adjust well to the right hander, tight on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
walks into a defensive shot to a good-length delivery which finds cover
now he brings out a punchy drive, on the up, which almost beats mid-off but Bopara dives to his left and parries the ball towards mid-on
swing and a miss! A typically flamboyant drive to a tempting full delivery outside off, but it nipped back and beat the inside edge
dragged down short and Dilshan doesn't miss out, pulling off the front foot in front of square
short of a length, neatly tucked off his body and played at the perfect pace which bisects square leg and long leg to allow a second
gets back onto off stump, Dilshan defends into the covers
excellent stroke, it's a short delivery outside off and he deliberately goes up and over point and places it wide of third man...would have been a boundary on a faster outfield

fortune this time, and nearly a run out! Gurney went fuller, Perera came forward to drive and got a think insid edge and raced off for a single which left him scampering to the far end. Out with a hit
short again and again it costs a boundary, not the way to go by the looks of things. Easy pickings for Dilshan as he pulls backward of square
back to full at off stump, no holding back from Dilshan as he drives firmly off the front foot to cover
slips this down the leg side...a touch ragged by England
that's a better delivery, fuller at middle and off, takes a think inside edge into Dilshan's front pad as he lunges forward
some seam movement to end the over, nips back into Dilshan and takes him high on the back pad
another low full toss, but doesn't cost any runs as he drives straight to cover
tucked off his pad down to long leg
full outside off, drives away from his body without any footwork and the balls skews off a think inside edge towards square leg
short of a length on leg stump, played towards midwicket
full on middle and leg, he flicks it just to the left of Root at mid-on to keep the strike rotating
aiming for a yorker, it doesn't quite pitch, flicked to Stokes at midwicket
that's where Gurney needs to be more often that not, full around middle and off, defended to cover
drifts onto leg stump this time, a well-timed flick in the air over square leg races towards the boundary but Stokes is able to get around and stop it one-handed
picks up a full, straight delivery and lofts it over midwicket...more work for Stokes running round from deep square
wrong line again, outside leg stump and this time he picks it up over the leg side with the power and placement to reach the deep midwicket rope
still angling into the pads, lucky this doesn't cost him more runs as it takes the pad of Perera
full on middle, which with the angle makes it a bit too straight, tucked gently into midwicket to keep the strike
full on off stump, he stretches forward and defends
a beauty! Turn and bounce. Lovely flight, it grips from around off stump and rips past the outside edge as he comes forward. Buttler can't take it cleanly
drops short and wide this time, he rocks back and cuts as the ball sits up nicely but again the outfield cuts off the boundary
full and defended to cover
runs on with the air towards middle and leg, takes an inside edge towards short fine leg
opens his stance a fraction and drives a full delivery down to long-off...steals the strike again
starts on middle and leg, from over the wicket, defended towards midwicket
now he pulls down a delivery too short, pulled over midwicket to bring up a very useful fifty stand...the opening pair was a major problem in India
adjusts to being full on middle, defended towards mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended with a straight bat back to the bowler
terrific strike, England pay for bowling short again. Even though Perera was starting to come forward he has time to rock back and pull it over the deep midwicket boundary.
defends to mid-on
worked off the back foot to midwicket
goes down early and paddle-sweeps from outside off through short fine-leg...deft touch, it's not all power from him
round the wicket, full on off stump, defended
dragged down short, pulled along the ground to deep square-leg
taken from outside off and work down to long-on
easily done by Perera as he opens the face a touch and drives to long-off
not as short as before, but still back of a length, and pulled off the front foot high over mid-on. Dismissive. The message isn't getting through to the bowlers
now he's full outside leg, flicked down to fine leg...wayward stuff
he's being taken apart here, this time a length delivery is clubbed over mid-on and goes one bounce over the boundary
gets it fuller, on middle and leg, defended square into the off side
very full at off stump, hammered to mid-off...almost shot-a-ball at the moment
short of a length, this time it's a rare defensive shot into the covers. Chastening start for Stokes.
patted into the off side
uses his feet, gets to the pitch and drills it back to Tredwell
held back this time, Dilshan waits a fraction longer and tucks gently into midwicket
fuller outside off, drags Dilshan forward and he defends into the covers
skips forward again, tucks a full delivery down to long-on with a flick of the wrists
defended into the off side...Tredwell on the money in that over
starts straight and gets worked into the midwicket area
round the wicket, driven back to the bowler
dragged down short, he cuts firmly straight to the cover sweeper
gets a touch too straight this time, allows Dilshan to tickle it off the pads down to fine leg
this one slides down the leg side and is called wide...needs to get outside off
that's more like it, Dilshan stretches forward and plays it with a closed face to square leg
touch shorter, he opens the face and finds backward point...for a moment wanted a single but Perera wisely sends him back
forward on off stump, defended to cover
sweeps a straighter delivery, goes one bounce to short fine leg
shorter outside off, starts to come forward then jumps back to cut out to deep cover
more neat footwork, down the pitch, and just helps it down the ground with no fuss whatsoever
a cracker! More spin for Tredwell. Half an appeal for caught behind as Perera is beaten all ends up
now he leans forward and defends towards backward point. Another nice over from Tredwell.
tossed up just outside off, Dilshan out to meet it and kicks it away to leg
a little short and whipped out to deep square, just fine of the fielder so they charge hard for two
down to paddle this length ball from outside off over his shoulder, chase to deep square's right again
forward pressing a straighter ball through midwicket for a single
around to the leftie, full ball patted back up the wicket
tries to advance, can only punch back to the bowler again
length on off stump, pressed into point for a quick single
similar length, middle stump line tucked out to deep midwicket
fuller, long stride out to play firmly down to long-on
rocks back giving himself room and cuts to deep cover
waits for this on the back foot and presses from around off stump to deep cover
slips this down the leg side but Perera can only sweep it to short long leg, got away with one
and almost in the game straight away, swept but only off the pad in the range of the catcher
waits in the crease and nudges through midwicket
solid forward defence
just outside off, a few stride down the wicket and a firm punch to extra cover
flatter ball, Perera trying to give himself room has to lean out and down to force this into the covers
a little more room to work with and cuts hard wide of deep cover for a couple
back across the off stump to flick a single through midwicket
forward press to block to cover
another block on the front foot
straight ball, swept backward of square and that's four, picked the gap nicely
forward running this in front of short long leg for a quick single, hundred up
stays around, gives Dilshan some angle with which to tickle this backward of deep square to try for two but they can't
Dilshan rocks back and flashes hard and gets it behind point, great shot, wasn't short or wide at all
fuller and straighter, this is tickled back to the bowler
full again, tucked to short midwicket
swept off a straight line, misses, cry for lbw but it would have slid down leg
waited for on the back foot, cut out to deep cover
forward on off stump to defend back to the bowler
full on off stump, calmly flicked down to long-on
good length on middle, blocked back to the bowler
swept off a slightly more middle and leg line, gets it out to deep square
stays back and looks to dab out on the off side but gets a thick inside edge to the right of short long leg and that's Dilshan's fifty now
swung to leg from a full ball on off, Tredwell leaps at short midwicket but can't hold on with an outstretched right hand well above his head, great effort, closest England have come to a wicket
aims leg side again with Bopara around the wicket, off-speed delivery and batsman was deceived and struck on the pad
full on the stumps, tucked through midwicket for a quick single
this slips down leg, Perera missed with a sweep
yorker length, this is dug out towards point
held back a little, waited for and driven to deep cover
down the wicket and lofted down the ground, Bopara around to his left from long-on but lets the ball slip under him and it runs into the rope, poor work
straighter line on a length, tucked through square leg
full length on off stump, strong forward defence
very full wide of off stump, Dilshan reaches for it and misses

bit of a leg side heave from off stump but gets it wide of deep midwicket, chance for a second but there's a total mix up! And Perera is run out by miles. Disaster for Sri Lanka after such a good start. It appeared both batsman wanted the second, both set off strongly but then Dilshan suddenly stopped, Perera hesitated before deciding to carry on but the damage was done, Dilshan was going nowhere, retreated back into his ground leaving an easy lob from Bopara to Buttler for the run out. Whoops!
full and a foot down the leg side
full just outside off, pressed to short cover
wider and Sangakkara is off the mark with a dab to third man
full just outside off, driven to extra cover
full length, Dilshan props forward to another off-speed delivery and it pops in the air back up the wicket but away from any fielders
full delivery, pressed down to long-on
down the wicket, meets a full toss and whacks it straight back down the 22, well avoided by the umpire, poor ball
down the track again, tucked out to long-on

length ball, this turns off the straight and given out lbw! To the surprise of many and the batsman reviews after a quick chat with his partner. This gripped off middle and leg, turned to beat the outside edge and is going on to hit middle and off stump. Lovely delivery from Moeen, deceiving Sangakkara into aiming leg side, and a good decision from the umpire
flicked off the stumps to leg slip is it? No just short! Almost another
outside off stump line and flicked through midwicket
length a foot outside off stump, poked to point
slips this down leg
another leg side wide
back of a length, tapped into midwicket for a quick single
similar delivery, Dilshan up on his toes to defend
fuller ball around off stump, pressed into the off side
better length, Dilshan playing forward is beaten on the outside edge
full ball down the leg side, not the best radar here from Gurney, Buttler can't gather and they sneak a run
back outside off, left alone
skip down the wicket and Dilshan lifts this inside long-off, lovely shot, great timing and placement
forward blocking this flatter ball into midwicket
tried to flash this from the crease through the covers but got a bottom edge into his pad
just full of a length on the off stump, played back to the bowler
straight line and tucked through square leg
full length on the stumps, this is ran through square leg
full on the stumps, clipped to deep square's left but they don't risk the second this time, mindful of the earlier run out no doubt
length just outside off, tickled down to third man
tight off stump delivery, dead-panned in the crease
cutter, slides past Jayawardene's outside edge rather poking from the crease
but there's the loose one to relieve pressure, full and wide and Jayawardene drives handsomely through the covers but the outfield is so slow it doesn't reach the rope
press forward and Dilshan is off like a whippet and gets home for a very sharp single
forward tickling this through square leg for a quick single
floated up just outside off, pressed back to the bowler
down the track, swung leg side and dropped by a leaping Morgan at short midwicket with a full-length dive to his right, would have been a superb catch
forward and pressed to cover
straight line and tucked to midwicket this time
down the track, forced off side and gets it over the top. Decent control, another good piece of timing and it runs away to the rope
full length on off stump, defended towards point
length ball, might have a nibbled away a little and Jayawardene is beaten outside off looking to run it down to third man
fuller and driven out wide of deep cover and they come back for a second
full on off stump, pressed firmly up the wicket
a touch wider and pressed firmly to mid-off
slower ball, waited for a dabbed down fine of third man for a sharp couple
dabbed from off stump into midwicket for an easy run
premeditated paddle sweep from off stump, Buttler tries to anticipate it and almost reached across to grab it, runs away to deep square
forward and pressed through the the covers
straighter line, flicked leg side and deep square can't prevented the second
held this back, Jayawardene waits for it and tucks this through square leg
wide on the crease angled in, Dilshan pats this back up the wicket to the bowler
another slower ball, takes a bottom edge into the ground not far from the stumps
tight on off stump, driven to cover
shorter outside off, Jayawardene waits and waits for the ball to loop off the surface before opening the face to angle the ball backward of point
short again, and straighter, gets pulled through midwicket
chases a full, wide delivery and gets beaten, good take by Buttler. Jayawardene indicates that he thinks that's a wide. Seems a fair call from the umpire
shapes back into him from outside off, delicately glided down to third
turned into square leg
taken from outside off and worked down to long on
goes deeper in his crease to a shorter delivery, works it off his hip to deep square
pushes this a little close to off stump, helped around the corner down to fine leg
back outside off, but it's easily worked away by Dilshan who picks off another single to long on
very similar from Mahela this time, no risk cricket as he works another one down the ground
and that's a pretty awful start, short and pushes way down the leg side. Jayawardene just lets it go through for the wide call
and another, speared down the leg side again, banged in half way down the pitch. This won't do his confidence any good
gets it outside off stump, it's still very short, opens the face to third man
he can't seem to pitch the ball up, or doesn't want to, and offers a short one which is pulled to deep square
wrong line, Stokes is having a nightmare, pitched in his half as this whole over has been...this time Jayawardene catches up with it with a well-controlled pull, rolling the wrists
finally, gets it fuller on off stump, defended to cover
full outside off, comes forward and drives to mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
on a length outside off, defended with an open face to point
back of a length, bit of nip and extra pace, takes the inside edge of Jayawardene's bat as he defends
full on off stump, worked into the leg side towards midwicket and it's a well-judged single
loses his line, full on leg stump, flicked sweetly to long leg
good short delivery from Woakes, Jayawardene tries to ramp it down to third man and his angry with himself for missing out but it skidded on with decent pace...Buttler fumbled behind the stumps
fuller and outside off, chopped down to third man
full at the stumps, worked along the ground through midwicket
round the wicket, full and straight, worked towards mid-on and this is a pretty tight single
this is well bowled, Jayawardene was moving outside leg but Gurney followed him with a back-of-a-length delivery which cramps him for room
a slower ball, a fuller delivery outside off, he is through his shot early and mistimes to cover
drops in a shorter one, Jayawardene gets inside the line and flicks it in the air towards long leg...goes one bounce to Moeen
another slower ball, back of the hand, hits a full length and it's flicked to midwicket
slips out as a full toss, probably aiming for a yorker, but only costs a single as Dilshan clubs it in rather ungainly fashion to deep midwicket
flicked off the pads backward of square on the leg side, they wanted a couple but the fielder was quickly off the rope
short of a length at leg stump, Jayawardene gives himself room outside leg and runs it down to third man
length outside off, he connects cleanly with his cut but picks out point
that's a wayward delivery down the leg side and adds to the wide tally
full and straight, or shading towards leg stump, flicked out to deep square

close! Falls just short of Bopara at long leg. It was a short ball which was pulled cleanly and almost too much so, Bopara starts to come in but then decides he won't make it and opts to prevent the boundary rather than gamble on a dive
gets lucky this time, angled into the pads, glances off the thigh guard and Buttler makes a good save diving to his left
round the wicket to the right hander, flicked off the pads to deep square
a bouncer, called a wide, might be a little hard done by there...ah, no, it was probably a fair enough call. Well over Mahela's head
slower ball, becomes a full toss outside off, heaved into midwicket
opens the face and bunts a length delivery to point
ah, fantastic stroke, that's really classy from Jayawardene as he rocks back to pull a short ball wide of long leg. Poor delivery, but it was such an effortless stroke
gets back on a full length, clubbed to midwicket without a touch less grace than the previous delivery
this has more brutal power, he picks up a length delivery and launches it high over mid-on...one bounce over the boundary

top catch! No hundred for Dilshan. It was a length delivery, a slower ball in off-cutter mode, Dilshan was aiming to work it into the leg side and gets a fat leading edge which loops back down the pitch, but on the on side, and Woakes dives across from his follow through to hold the catch one-handed
gives Mathews a short ball first up, it's a decent line but Mathews just has to sway his head out of the line
fuller and driven firmly to mid-off
another bouncer, very short and very loopy this time, and that's a comfortable wide
short of a length, at the body, Mathews prods it into the leg side
back of a length outside off, glided straight to short third man
that's the luck of the draw in one-day cricket, Jayawardene showing intent by using his feet, Woakes sends down a low full toss which is edged down to third man
full outside off, skids on a touch, defended to midwicket
this time he picks out square leg
tight start from Tredwell, pushed into the off side
gets across outside off, goes down and paddle-sweeps out to deep square-leg
works this from off stump into the deep leg-side field
a quicker delivery, almost defeats Mathews who is caught on the back foot but he squirts it to backward square. Good over from Tredwell
flicked to short fine leg
full outside off, bunted down to long on wide of Moeen's out-stretched hand
easily worked from outside off to deep square, nothing too fierce yet from Sri Lanka
well, so much for my previous comment! Mathews uses his feet and dispatches Moeen over deep midwicket. Clean strike
and now he hammers a straight drive, he put his full force behind that and it skimmed over the outfield
quicker and flatter, well bowled, pushed into the off side
slog swept and gets it just in front of deep square to bring up yet another ODI fifty for Jayawardene
another sweep, this time along the ground to deep square
back and pressing to midwicket
back on the stumps again and forces this in front of deep square so they can scramble a couple
flat delivery, waited for in the crease and worked through square leg for an easy single
yorker length, dug back to the bowler
not a great comeback, wide down leg
full well outside off, reached for and dug into the covers
tighter line, pressed off the back foot to point
full and wide and in the slot for Mathews to swing through, he gets plenty on it and gets it wide of deep cover
straighter line, tucked to short long leg and they sprint a quick single
length on off stump, played forward towards point and they get an easy single
gives himself room to swing the arms to a full ball on off stump, only finds extra cover
swept hard from outside off to deep cover
length ball whacked rather agriculturally out to long-on where Stokes fumbles and they get back for the second easily
low full toss hammered back over Stokes' head, another meaty club from Mathews
down the ground and this is heaved again, low on the bat but carries well over the straight boundary Mathews wants a real piece of Tredwell here, a huge strike

another one high, high into the air but this time Stokes is under it and that's a fine catch. Barely a foot in from the long-on boundary, Stokes down on his knees almost has held on very well to a mighty steepler from Mathews who went too big once too often, not timed again and this time not enough club to get away with it

this slips down the leg side, Jayawardene tickles at it and there's a big appeal for caught behind and given out! A second big wicket for England. This has come right off the face of the bat and Jos Buttler has pouched a very smart catch down the leg side
full just outside off, pressed into the covers
back of a length, fended off into square leg for an easy single
full on middle and leg, flicked firmly but jolly well saved by short midwicket getting down to his left in a flash
sliding across the left-hander who drives and misses
back of a length, a jabbed pull towards deep square, just a single
a tickle down the leg side, long leg is quickly to his left and saves the second - very sharp work
fired in from around the wicket, turned out to deep square
this grips a little and produces a leading edge into the covers
yorker length dug out back to the bowler
gives himself a little room and forces out to deep cover
a skip down the wicket and whipped off an inside edge out to deep square
heaved leg side off the stumps and gets it wide of long-on for a much-welcome boundary for the hosts

length on the off stump, driven up over the infield is it? Cook running back takes the catch diving away from him, splendid take and another wicket falls, England really pegging things back here. No timing on the stroke and not enough power either to clear Cook running back from extra cover
waits for this to come across him and angles down to third man
length on off stump, just blocked into the covers
leg side wide, not what England need now they're on top
short and pulled very handsomely in front of square - loose again, this time short and very well put away, great timing
fuller on off stump, angled down to third man, just a single
tight off stump line, this only angled to backward point
full on the stumps, tucked into midwicket and they have a quick single
glorious shot, gives himself a little room and drives on the up over the covers, timed to perfection
a shuffle across the stumps and tucked into midwicket for a single
dropped into midwicket again, Moeen and Buttler don't quite know who is fielding this, Buttler does eventually after they've taken the single
fuller and dropped through midwicket again
swept off middle and leg to short long leg who makes a poor fumble because the ball wasn't travelling that quickly and they get another run
length on the stumps, flicked out through square leg for an easy single
goes for the yorker, ends up a low full toss but only played to short midwicket
slower ball, batsman almost falls over but manages to pull it through square leg and they get two in the end
another slower ball, Gurney saw the batsman coming at him so sent it wider, batsman reached way out for it and managed to get a toe on it preventing a wide
full on the stumps, punched down to long-on and they charge back for a second, getting home comfortably in the end
low full toss on leg stump, clipped wide of long leg and that ruins a good over for Gurney
back of a length and Mendis whacks it over long leg, helped on it's way and it's sailed into the stands
yorker length on off stump, reached for as Mendis had backed away and got it to deep cover
slower ball, back of a length, turned only as far as long leg this time
full on off stump and that's a classical off drive that beats mid-off to bring the 300 up, lovely timing
slower ball, just outside off stump and with no long-off this is asking to be whacked down the ground, Mendis nails it and clears the boundary
now a leg side wide
full on leg stump, flicked around the corner, Cook dives at short long leg and can't cut it off, they get two more
decent yorker, inside edge fine of long leg for a couple
slower ball pushed down the leg side
turned off the stumps to long leg, just a single
yorker, dug out to long-off
full on off stump, pushed down the ground, they will try for two but Bell is up quickly from long-on
steps across his stumps to delicately paddle a single to long leg - good job he changed his bat *guffaws*
good yorker, squeezed to cover

inn2.comm: back of a length on off stump, defended to the off side
a touch fuller, Cook stays deep in his crease and defends towards mid-on

early strike! Nips back into Cook and strikes him on the front pad. The umpire gives it and it looks good in real time, but Cook calls for the review...and it's a good review! It's going over the stumps
and given again! And Cook reviews for a second time! It pitches in line, shapes back in and for a second time the ball is going over the stumps. Cook on form with the review.
gets a length ball outside, cuts firmly to cover
full at off stump, getting some nice shape, driven firmly to mid-off. Excellent start by Mathews
nice start for Moeen, upper-cuts a short delivery with some width high over backward point
superb fielding, Moeen plays a sweetly-timed off drive to a full delivery and it gets intercepted by the captain at mid-off
another flying Sri Lankan fielder, this time Dilshan at backward point, prevents a boundary from Cook's strong cut shot
full on off stump, Cook forces himself forward and gets a thickish inside edge into the leg side
this is driven square of the wicket with an open face, it pulls up across the slow outfield
nice delivery, fuller outside off, Moeen lets it go through to the keeper
gets it full at off stump, driven straight of mid-off, nicely time but it can't make it all the way
left alone outside off
comes forward into a length delivery, opens the face a touch as he drive to find a gap at cover
goodness me! Moeen has had a stroke of fortune here as he goes for the pull, the ball takes the bottom edge, trickles down his pad and hits the base of middle stump
full on middle, flicked to mid-on
pushed across wider outside, he goes for a pull but he can't reach it
full and wide outside off, Cook chases it but can't make contact...must have been close to a wide
he's beaten again, in defence this time, by a delivery that was tighter to off stump and drew him into an uncertain poke without much footwork
full on middle and leg, flicked through square leg
on a length at off stump, punched sweetly off the back foot to short cover
another lovely piece of timing, flicked off his pads through straight midwicket but it was well chased down by Kusal Perera manages to flick it back
short and wide, Cook chases it, Sangakkara dives across for a good take and there's an appeal from behind the wicket...and then it's called wide. The Sri Lankans decide not to review
some timing from the England captain, sort off...gets some width and cuts hard through the off side but it still can't overcome the outfield
flamboyant from Moeen, seizes on a full and wide delivery and lofts it on the up over the off side, one bounce across the rope...that takes the outfield out of the equation
drives again, this time he wasn't in as good a position, leaning back on the shot, the think edge flies wide of the lone slip to third man
that's superb from Moeen, stands tall and pierces the off side with a drive on the up which races through the covers. Lovely and elegant.
goes for a cut and gets beaten on the bottom edge
good comeback, straightens his line towards off stump and it nips away off the seam to beat the outside edge. Moeen's feet a little stuck in the crease
a guided, controlled edge wide of the slip and fine of third man...a brisk start from Moeen
low full toss, Cook comes forward and places it through the off side...chased down and flicked back close to the boundary. Cook is needing to do plenty of running this evening
tries to pull a back-of-a-length delivery which is angling across and it scoots under the bottom edge
stand and deliver! Pushed up full outside off, he takes a stride forward and slots it between cover and mid-off with a full flourish of a follow through
and another! The off side is getting peppered by Moeen, but his drive is being fed at the moment. This was another full, wide delivery which allowed him to free his arms and drive over point
three in a row, but this one not as authentic as he takes a think outside edge, quite close to the bottom of the bat, and goes wide of slip again
make that four in a row...and it's another edge, Moeen flaying at a length delivery which skims past the stumps down to fine leg. He's giving it his all.
this time he is gone! Not reviewing. Spin breaks the stand. Round the wicket, skids on with the arm, Cook looking to work to the leg side and is taken low down on the front pad
play and a miss first ball for Bell as he goes for a cut and the ball bounces over the top edge
goes back to a shorter delivery and pushes down the ground
dragged down short, Moeen rocks back and pulls powerful through midwicket...poor delivery and he cashed in
another pull, but this time the ball wasn't as short, he had to be quick not to be beaten by it skidding on...the ball went high in the air for a while, but landed short of deep square-leg
uses his feet, clubs it towards mid-on
slightly short to start with, Bell is on the back foot, opens the face and places it wide of point
loses his shape this time as he comes down the pitch, aiming to the leg side, he wasn't to the pitch but managed to cloth it to long on
he's given a short ball and doesn't waste it, pulling powerfully over midwicket and keeps it well out of reach of the deep fielders at long on and deep square
fuller outside off, driven and it squirts off a think edge wide of slip and fine of short third man
a controlled drive this time, picked out cover
drifts into the pads, worked in front of square on the leg side
round the wicket, full and pushed back to the bowler
defended with soft hands
angled into leg stump, skids on and takes Bell on the pad but going well down the leg side
drifts outside leg stump, goes for a sweep and it comes off the glove but fine of the deep, wide leg slip...conventional catcher may have taken that
he has to watch this one carefully, it's quite short but doesn't really get up, Bell's stumps are exposed as he drives off the back foot to cover

another fantastic stroke, picks up a strong sweep from outside off and it pings to the deep backward square-leg boundary in a flash...superb fifty from 25 balls, the second fastest by an England batsman
driven off the back foot to cover
ah, lovely footwork, sweet stuff as he skips down the pitch and plays the perfect lofted drive over mid-off
close! Goes for a cut, gets a bottom edge into the ground and it bounces over the stumps wide of the keeper
comes forward and defends
full and straight, connects cleanly with the sweep and there's a good piece of fielding at deep square-leg
speared in full at leg stump, Bell skips outside the line and drives to mid-off
premeditated sweep, he actually ends up playing it to quite a short delivery, gets a top edge over the keeper but wasn't close to a catch
slow spin into Bell, he waits a fraction longer and pushes down the ground
tight to off stump, coming in with the angle, driven to cover
short of a length, opens the face and places it wide of cover
worked to the on side, Dilshan dives across in his follow through
on the back foot, places it to the deep cover sweeper
the Sri Lankans start to go up for a big lbw shout, but Bell has inside-edged this full delivery into his pad
drop-and-run into the off side, Bell defends the ball down by his feet and Moeen immediately calls him through
that's loose, a half-hearted cut which is a rare occasion when Moeen has put his full force behind a stroke
back of a length outside off, Moeen drives in the air over cover and wide of the sweeper but it's kept down to two
beaten again, a fuller delivery and Perera getting this ball to swing around, Moeen follows it as he plays away from his body
opens the face and glides it down to third man
full outside off, driven gently to deep cover
dragged down short, pulled over midwicket and wide of long on who makes a mess of his attempted sliding save...Thisara Perera is the culprit
on off stump, defended back to the bowler
flicked to square leg
short, sits in the pitch a little, Bell bunts it down the ground
short, cut to backward point
angled down the leg side, Bell tries to tickle it away, it's called wide much to Sri Lanka's surprise - the bowler was half-appealing for the catch
tight run! Bell comes forward, gets an inside edge into his pad and the ball rolls into the off side...Bell would have made it safely
another half appeal - although Sanga wasn't excited - as Moeen plays away from his body and is beaten as the ball slides across him
almost finds the fielder! Offered up width, he chases it with a cut shot which comes off the bottom of the bat but doesn't quite reach deep cover who was running in
that's a lovely piece of bowling, full outside off, seaming away and beats Bell as he comes forward
opens the face down to the third man
full outside off, digs it out through midwicket...100 up for England at a terrific rate
full at the stumps, pushed firmly down to long on
very neatly played, it's quite close to off stump as it slides into Bell but he plays a well-controlled late cut
tossed up a little fuller and slower, pushed down the ground
comes forward and defends to the off side
just out of Herath's reach! A full delivery is driven back in the air, Herath flings himself to his left and just gets his fingertips to it
pushed into the off side

decent length just outside off, Bell gets a thickish outside edge and is taken at slip! Breakthrough for Sri Lanka. Bell playing defensively to a ball that might have just left him slightly and edging at waist height for an easy chance that's comfortably taken at slip
full at off stump, Root blocks it up the wicket
forward tucking this into the gap at cover and Root is away
forward to a ball on off stump, pressed into the covers
driven towards mid-off this time, again no run
bumper down the leg side ... apparently okay on width and height !
forward nudging into a gap at cover and they get a quick single
defended on the back foot just outside off stump
down the track and whammo! A huge heave over midwicket and that's gone way back into the stands, biggest six of the day
and another! This time over a squarer area and not quite as long, still a big slow and Moeen's highest ODI score now
meets a low full toss and plays to midwicket
back across the off stump just defending again
back of a length, Root on his toes to punch to extra cover
bit of width but Root can't time this cut and only gets it to cover
square slash and a superb save by Dilshan diving to his right at backward point, very sharp
bumper, Root plays a hook from a not very good position and misses
fuller length, Root driving at it and edging behind! Root's poor footwork the undoing of him once again. Pushed back, then drawn forward and he gets a feather edge to the keeper
very nicely bowled, right up there, slides across Morgan who is beaten on the outside edge
Moeen trying to advance can only play back to the bowler
slog sweep towards deep midwicket but in the air, chance for Jeevan Mendis and dropped! Pretty straightforward chance and Mendis has let that bounce right out of his hands

paddle swept, appeal for lbw, did it pitch outside leg? No the umpire gives runs. But the Sri Lankans like this and review. Morgan did shuffle across quite a bit - you could see middle and leg stumps as he played the shot - he gets hit in line with leg stump perhaps but it's pitched well outside leg stump, very poor review really and now it's gone. It was Sangakkara that wanted that reviewed
another sweep from Moeen, gets it down to deep backward square

Morgan forward just outside off pushing towards the covers and gets an inside edge onto his stumps! England lose another and are now in a bit of trouble. A gentle prod forward slightly away from his body and Morgan has dragged this on
full just outside off, driven out to deep cover
yorker, dug out into the covers
length ball angled across Moeen who drives pleasantly wide of deep cover for a couple
bit wider this but Moeen can only mistime a stroke to cover
slightly tighter line but Moeen able to open the face and angle down to third man for a single
quite wide and it bounces a little on Buttler who misses with a cut
bumper, too bumpy
back just back of a length, Buttler lets it go
back trying to work to leg but gets an inside edge into his pad
swept out to deep square off the stumps
forward playing carefully back to the bowler
back trying to move this into the leg side, only finds midwicket
back again, this time works it through more of a square leg area and they run hard for two
back once again, punching down to long-on
good length, Buttler plays away from his body and gets beaten outside off
slightly fuller and this is played firmly to cover
fuller still and even more firmly played, timed very well and deep cover runs around to his right and saves well
too full and Buttler casually whips his hands through the ball and knocks it for six miles over long-on ... as you do
drags the length back and Buttler misses with a forcing stroke off the back foot
gradually fuller and gradually shorter this over, pulled now over square leg for a single
paddle swept from off stump and Buttler runs hard and calls Moeen back for a second
poor ball way down leg, Sangakkara can't gather and they get two extra extras
back on off stump and Buttler knocks it up the wicket
waited for and played from the crease out to long-on
back and turned from off stump to midwicket
full on leg stump and Moeen picks it up beautifully over square leg, it sails back, another lovely clean strike
flatter ball sliding across Moeen's off stump, he's back to try and late cut and misses
full just outside off, Buttler mistimes a drive to mid-on
better length, Buttler on the crease gets a thick outside edge to point
dragged back a little and Buttler pulls firmly, chase around for deep midwicket and his slide is not in time

back on a decent length, Buttler props forward and gets an inside edge which bounces and then cannons leg stump! Very bad time for England to lose another wicket. Buttler was trying to sort of angle this away but it came back on him a little and the inside edge found the outside edge of leg stump
forward just outside off, pressed towards mid-off
back of a length, Bopara blocking up on his toes
angled across Moeen who drops this fine and they get a quick single
forward press from off stump out to deep cover
back and tucking this into the leg side
Moeen forward and this strikes him on the pad well outside the line of leg
forward running this in front of point for an easy run
flat delivery, they generall all are, defended comfortably in the crease

Back of a length, Moeen pulls firmly and gets this past mid-on, the outfield is so slow and it doesn't run for four causing them to scamper back for a third that might have been tight for Moeen at the bowler's end with a direct hit
forward press in front of point who fumbles and they get a run
full length driven very solidly back to the bowler who drops an incredibly tough return chance. He shoved two hands up and only got a fingertip on it
back of a length down the leg side, comes off the thigh pad surely to Sangakkara, indeed not out
full on the stumps and Moeen whips it into the crowd over midwicket! Such gracious nonchalant strokemaking, timed it so perfectly
shortish again and this is tucked down to long leg
googly first up, a touch short, slapped off the back foot to cover
back and drops this into midwicket for a very sharp single
floated up and casually driven to mid-off
back and cuts but only finds cover again
forward and this slips past the outside edge
low full toss and tapped down to long-off and there's Moeen's hundred! An absolutely brilliant innings, the third-fastest for England's in ODI, superb batting
tossed onto middle and leg stumps, clipped out to long-on
back and nudging this down to long-on for an easy run again
back in a flash to a slightly short delivery and pulled right off the meat through midwicket
more air from the bowler, Moeen whips it down to long-on
tossed up again and Bopara drives and gets a thick inside edge through square leg
blocked carefully in the crease, another healthy over
tried to be swept as it snuck down the leg side but it was mighty close to leg stump
off stump now and rolled into the covers for an easy single
back to pull and Moeen gets a thick top edge over the bowler's head and gets away with it, the ball landing out of Mendis's reach
tossed up on off stump, Bopara drives carefully down to long-off
played forward on middle and gets a thick outside edge to point
another edge, this from a drive backward of point and they get a single
swept from middle and leg, Moeen misses, a big cry for lbw, not out given, would have probably gone down with the angle - Dilshan around the wicket - and Sri Lanka burned their review earlier
forward to nudge out in front of point for an easy single
back and there's some turn which cramps Bopara into an inside edge into his pad
trying to go back again plays towards cover
across the stumps this time and tucking this behind square leg
full length, Moeen whips it out to long-on
full length played out to long-off
middle and off line, Moeen forward playing back to the bowler
full delivery, dug out down the ground for an easy single
back to a shorter ball and slapped out to long-on
short and pulled out into the deep, there's a man back at deep backward square but this just clears him

but now gone! Moeen propping forward and presenting a simple return catch for the bowler. Such a wonderful innings but this is a soft dismissal, too early on a little forward push and it's so easy for the bowler to take such an important wicket
beaten on the outside edge as he fiddles outside off
slips down the leg side
worked into the on side
forward to his first delivery and props it into the off side
driven square through off side, towards deep point, and there's nearly a mix-up as they look for a second
terrific anticipation from Sangakkara as he sees Bopara go to paddle sweep and moves outside leg stump to intercept the ball
swept very firmly to square leg
tossed up on middle and off, Bopara comes forward and defends
sweeps a very full delivery off the stumps and picks out backward square-leg who is inside the circle
full and driven down the ground
drops a fraction short outside off stump, Stokes cracks it very firmly out to deep cover
onto the back foot and drives with a straight bat to the deep
good line, tight on middle and off, hint of turn into Stokes who defends
comes forward, plays cautiously with an open face and finds space square into the covers
stays round the wicket to the left hander, pushed across outside off and defended
low full toss, whipped along the ground through midwicket
full at the stumps, keeping it along the deck as this one finds long off
flicked into midwicket and Dilshan pulls off a sharp save, diving across the other wickets and full stretch
uses his feet, Herath sees him drags his length back a touch which means Stokes can only prod to the leg side. Smart bowling
swept to square leg
on leg stump, tucked into midwicket
sort of a length, eased down the ground
shorter on leg stump, skids on and takes the pad to the leg side...not Stokes picks spin that well
goes back to this delivery, drives firmly to cover
dragged down short, pulled firmly out to deep square leg...boundaries have dried up for England
strong wrists as he flicks this straight down the pitch, just to the on side of the stumps, and Mendis can't get a hand on it
he was about to sweep this, a length delivery on off stump, but in the end stand in his upright stance and nudge into midwicket
round the wicket, skids on but Bopara watches closely and drives off the back foot to cover
now he cuts loose, uses his feet and comes down the pitch then pulls out a clean strike over long on...lovely swing of the arms through the ball. Held his shape
touch quicker and flatter, flicked along the ground to midwicket
full, outside off, driven very firmly to long off who is quite wide
goes to sweep a very full delivery and it skims under his bat...was almost trying to sweep a yorker in the end
superb fielding, backing up the bowler...and it's the captain, again. This time he's a short fine-leg and dives to cut off a sweep from Stokes after Herath drifted too full outside leg stump
living a little dangerously, trying to play off the back foot to the skiddy Mendis
this is punched more compactly down the ground to long on
he missed out here, it was dragged down short outside leg stump, Bopara connected cleanly with a pull but picked out short fine-leg
quick single! He drilled this off the back foot to mid-off, which means he has to push off the run, and would have been out with a direct hit
played off the stumps to the covers

brings out the reverse sweep, connects well and it's running close the boundary but then Kusal sprints into view and pulls out a full-length dive and then has the presence of mind to stop the ball rolling into the boundary as bobbled away from him. Precious run saved
punched along the ground to midwicket, Dilshan a livewire again
goes down the leg side as Stokes misses his sweep but not called wide
now he uses his feet but can only dig out a full delivery back to the bowler
this time the sweep comes off, a strong connection, but another Sri Lankan is racing around the boundary...Mathews said his team would work on their fielding
that's pressure! He was find it hard to get the ball away, he was itching to come down the pitch, ends up yorking himself, plays over the ball and a neat take by Sangakkara
he's forward and blocks
short delivery, Bopara drives off the back foot down to long on
fuller on middle and off, he's forward and defends with bat and pad together
works this from off stump to long on with a bottom-handed flick
gee, that's power from Bopara as he takes a full delivery from outside off stump and sweeps it with a crunching shot along the ground through midwicket. Blink and that was at the boundary
short this time, hammered again, but this time the pull picks out deep midwicket
another awful delivery, but again only costs a single. Was short and way outside leg, Woakes caught up with it with a pull but sends the ball once bounce to deep square-leg
starts with a short delivery on off stump, helped into the leg side
fuller on off stump, Bopara drops it with soft hands square towards point
well bowled! He's moved the ball all innings and this one nips back past Woakes' inside edge has he presses forward
full outside off, defended into the covers
just out of reach?! Another good bouncer, Woakes hooks and gets a top edge which flies over Sangakkara's out-stretched glove as he leaps skywards
pushed wide outside off, and too wide for the umpire who exercises his arms
big shot for a caught behind as Woakes drives and miss but there's no edge
forward on off stump pressing down to long-on
forward just outside off blocking into the covers

tossed up, lures Woakes down the wicket, he's beaten and what a stumping! Herath deceived both batsman and keeper with a lovely flighted ball that pitched on middle and leg and turned across the off stump, Woakes played to leg, missed and fell out of his ground but then Sangakkara - who was headed down the leg side - darted his hands to his right to take the ball and whip off the bails, superb work behind the stumps, and a beauty of a delivery
tossed up outside off, Tredwell drives at it and misses
cuts this out to deep point
thought Bopara might just take a single but he's given himself room and swung a full delivery over cover for four, lovely stroke
full length goes past Tredwell's outside edge as he drives
similar length, dug out into point, Dilshan comes hurtling to his left to save really well
forward on off stump, Tredwell finally gets off strike with a thick inside edge through midwicket
just a single, tickling a back of a length ball through square leg
similar delivery also dropped though square leg
back of a length, punched to extra cover and Tredwell stays on strike
floated up on leg stump, flicked through midwicket and Bopara is immediately back on strike
gives himself room aiming off side but can only find cover
floated up and Bopara heaves it over long-on, huge strike and that's his fifty, yet another lovely little cameo here
flatter delivery, nudged out on the on side but just a single
back and cut but only as far as extra cover
driven up in the air and just over extra cover, only a single so Tredwell again keeps the strike
full on leg stump, Tredwell forward and getting a thick inside edge through square leg
length on off stump, blocked into the covers
slower ball, Bopara tried to get across his stumps to flick leg side but could only get struck on the thigh pad
back and hit hard wide of long-on but the fielder does well going to his right and saves the boundary
gives himself room and aims over extra cover, gets its high but not that long, it plugs and they get back for the second

oh dear! A beamer and Bopara managed to hoik it backward of square for four. Real bonus for England, a beamer at head height and Bopara hooked it literally off his grille. Very valuable that for England
length ball, dead-batted, Bopara wants to play tip and run but Tredwell says no with the ball having not moved far off the popping crease
Tredwell backs away looking for a cut and gets bowled losing the top of his middle stump. The delivery skidded on quicker than Tredwell could attempt the cut stroke and he missed
wide of off stump, Gurney plays a lofted cover drive! Gets it in the gap and Bopara is back on strike
strong thump down the ground only straight on the bounce to long-off and Bopara refuses the run
swept from off stump and he finds the gap at square leg, superb shot, timed it beautifully, it hovered just above the ground to take the slow outfield out of the equation
goes leg side again but without connection and after some consideration decides on a single
wide of off stump and Gurney is able to leave this alone

length ball, smashed high into the night, it has gone so far up, deep square comes in, Kusal Perera is the fielder, he's misjudged it slightly but dives forward and takes a blinder! A stunning catch to win the game. The ball hung up in the sky for an age and was exceptionally well held to end England's stubborn resistance
